******  

As of March 2022, Rob began a new position at Washington State University.  

Rob Smith is a data scientist and analyst with Washington State University's [Office of Institutional Research](https://ir.wsu.edu/){target="_blank"}.  His work lies at the broad intersection of higher education and high-dimensional statistics.  Trained as a quantitative ecologist, he previously was a research fellow with US Forest Service's [Air Resource Management](https://www.fs.fed.us/air/index.htm){target="_blank"} and the [Forest Inventory and Analysis](https://www.fs.usda.gov/pnw/program/rma){target="_blank"} programs.  He has taught in the [Dept of Botany and Plant Pathology](https://bpp.oregonstate.edu){target="_blank"} at Oregon State University after earning his PhD there with a focus on detection and prediction of climate signals.  For a decade he worked in construction, mills, landscaping, and mountaineering.
